skill.name: building-chat-widgets
skill.description:
Build interactive AI chat widgets with buttons, forms, and bidirectional actions.
Use when creating agentic UIs with clickable widgets, entity tagging (@mentions),
composer tools, or server-handled widget actions. Covers full widget lifecycle.
NOT when building simple text-only chat without interactive elements.
skill.summary:
Build interactive AI chat widgets with buttons, forms, and bidirectional actions.
Use when creating ...
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code that poses security risks. Contains only documentation and a simple file-verification script that checks for required reference files within the skill directory.

content.value_statement: Creating chat widgets with buttons, forms, and actions is complex and undocumented. This skill provides complete patterns for client and server widget handling, entity tagging, and composer tools so you can build interactive AI interfaces faster.
actual_capabilities: Define widget templates with buttons, lists, and forms
Handle actions on client side for navigation and state
Handle actions on server side for data mutations
Create composer tool mode selection for AI agents
limitations: Requires an existing ChatKit or similar widget system integration
Does not include UI components or styling libraries
Pattern examples assume Python backend and TypeScript frontend

use_cases.title: Build clickable chat actions
use_cases.description: Create buttons and forms that dispatch actions to backend handlers for data mutations

use_cases.title: Design agentic chat interfaces
use_cases.description: Build interactive widgets that let users select, confirm, and navigate within AI conversations

use_cases.title: Connect widgets to backend
use_cases.description: Implement server action handlers that update widgets, trigger effects, and run agent responses

prompt_templates.title: Basic widget
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Button widget that dispatches a server action when clicked. Include a ListView with clickable items that select items.

prompt_templates.title: Form submission
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a server action handler that processes a form submission, creates a synthetic user message, and triggers the agent response.

prompt_templates.title: Entity tagging
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement entity tagging so users can @mention articles. Show the frontend onTagSearch callback and backend entity conversion.

prompt_templates.title: Composer modes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a composer with tool mode selection. Show the TOOL_CHOICES configuration and how the backend routes based on tool_choice metadata.

output_examples.input: Create a button widget that lets users select an item from a list
output: Widget template with ListView and clickable ListViewItem components
Server action handler that processes item selection and updates the widget state
Client action callback for local state updates after selection

best_practices: Keep client and server actions separate for the same action type to avoid conflicts
Use action.payload for data access, never action.arguments
Include all required fields when creating UserMessageItem: id, thread_id, created_at, inference_options
anti_patterns: Handling the same action type in both client and server handlers creates race conditions
Missing required fields in UserMessageItem causes validation errors
Using type='text' instead of type='input_text' for user message content

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Patterns show Python backend and TypeScript frontend examples.

faq.question: What are the limits on widget complexity?
faq.answer: No hard limits but recommend keeping widgets focused. Complex widgets should dispatch multiple simple actions.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing chat app?
faq.answer: The patterns assume a ChatKit-compatible widget system. Core patterns for actions and entities can adapt to other frameworks.

faq.question: Is user data safe when using widgets?
faq.answer: Yes. Widgets only transmit action payloads you define. Server handlers process data in your controlled backend.

faq.question: Why do I get 'Action has no attribute arguments' error?
faq.answer: Use action.payload instead of action.arguments. The skill documentation shows correct access patterns throughout.

faq.question: How is this different from standard chat UIs?
faq.answer: Widgets enable bidirectional communication. Actions flow from UI to backend, and widgets update dynamically based on server responses.
